title: 570.08 JUDGMENT FOR CLAIMANT, HOW SATISFIED.
text: If judgment is recovered by the claimant, the sheriff shall satisfy the judgment out of the property attached, if sufficient, first paying to claimant the proceeds of sales of perishable property and of all credits collected by the sheriff, or so much as may be required. If a balance remains due and an execution on the judgment is issued, the sheriff shall sell as much of the attached property as may be necessary to satisfy the balance. The fees and costs of the sheriff shall be deducted before any payment to the claimant.
